label.label: After the usage record is staged, you will not be able to update the usage lines.

checkbox-group.options: {[{id: '0', label: `${page.state.confirmStageBin0}`, checked: `${page.state.binflag === '0' || ''}`, selectedIcon: 'carbon:checkmark--filled', unselectedIcon:'carbon:radio-button'},{id: '2', label: `${page.state.confirmStageBin2}`, checked: `${page.state.binflag === '2' || ''}`, selectedIcon: 'carbon:checkmark--filled', unselectedIcon:'carbon:radio-button'}, {id: '1', label: `${page.state.confirmStageBin1}`, checked: `${page.state.binflag === '1' || ''}`, selectedIcon: 'carbon:checkmark--filled', unselectedIcon:'carbon:radio-button'}]}

label.label: The status of the inventory usage record cannot be changed to Complete. You must create a shipment in order to transfer the items

The status of the inventory usage cannot be changed to Complete. Your organization requires a shipment in order to transfer items. Ensure that all items are going to the same site, then create a shipment.

The status of inventory usage cannot be changed to COMPLETE. The organization requires a PO reference for each line being shipped. Either delete, or specify a PO reference to change status to COMPLETE.
The status of inventory usage cannot be changed to SHIPPED. The organization requires a PO reference for each line being shipped. Either delete, or specify a PO reference to change status to SHIPPED.
After the transfer is complete, you cannot create a shipment for this inventory usage record.
You cannot stage inventory usage records that include returned items.

You must define a default storeroom for this user before issuing or transferring items.

You cannot open inventory usage records that include returns, reservations that require transfer or are of MIXED type in the Issues and Transfers mobile app. Use the Inventory Usage application to make changes.
Use the default stage bin for each item.
Use a new stage bin that will be used for all usage lines being staged.
